Alder Hey teams shortlisted for Health Service Journal Awards! ğŸ¤© Congratulations to our Emergency Department and Respiratory Parent Champions in the Community teams, which have both been shortlisted for the HSJ Awards ğŸ† Our Emergency Department has been shortlisted for the Performance Recovery Award for its 'ED at its Best' programme. This initiative delivered massive and sustained performance improvements in the department. The 'Respiratory Parent Champions in the Community' programme has been shortlisted for the Early Intervention and Prevention for Children, Young People and Families Award for its work in reducing bronchiolitis admission rates. Respiratory Parent Champions in the Community is a dynamic peer-support program launched jointly by Alder Hey and Liverpool Children's Centres in January 2022. Alder Hey employs mothers as Parent Champions, delivering essential advice and support to families in Liverpool's most deprived wards, to empower parents and reduce inequalities in bronchiolitis and early years respiratory health. Congratulations to our very own Mr Sunil Sharma, who has been appointed Training Programme Director for ENT for the entire North West region. As an Alder Hey consultant, Sunil will be leading our role in medical education at a regional level in ENT. I'm also hoping to improve awareness and support for our diverse group of trainees, as well as promoting less than full time training amongst both trainees and trainers - in ENT we have some of the largest numbers of less than full time trainees amongst surgical specialties." Congratulations and best of luck to Sunil in his new role!
